root@blm-plesk-4-2-lon:/srv/chatPriorities/chat-gpt-celery-flask# /usr/bin/python -m pip -V
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<frozen runpy>", line 189, in _run_module_as_main
  File "<frozen runpy>", line 148, in _get_module_details
  File "<frozen runpy>", line 112, in _get_module_details
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/pip/__init__.py", line 22, in <module>
    from pip._vendor.requests.packages.urllib3.exceptions import DependencyWarning
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/pip/_vendor/__init__.py", line 73, in <module>
    vendored("pkg_resources")
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/pip/_vendor/__init__.py", line 33, in vendored
    __import__(modulename, globals(), locals(), level=0)
  File "/usr/share/python-wheels/pkg_resources-0.0.0-py2.py3-none-any.whl/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 77, in <module>
  File "/usr/share/python-wheels/pkg_resources-0.0.0-py2.py3-none-any.whl/pkg_resources/_vendor/packaging/requirements.py", line 9, in <module>
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 1178, in _find_and_load
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 1149, in _find_and_load_unlocked
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 674, in _load_unlocked
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 634, in _load_backward_compatible
  File "/usr/share/python-wheels/pkg_resources-0.0.0-py2.py3-none-any.whl/pkg_resources/extern/__init__.py", line 43, in load_module
  File "/usr/share/python-wheels/pkg_resources-0.0.0-py2.py3-none-any.whl/pkg_resources/_vendor/pyparsing.py", line 943, in <module>
AttributeError: module 'collections' has no attribute 'MutableMapping'

The error message you encountered suggests that the `collections` module in Python does not have an attribute called `MutableMapping`. This issue could occur if you are using an older version of Python that does not have this attribute or if there is a problem with the installation of the `pip` package.

To troubleshoot this issue, you can try the following steps:

1. Verify Python version: Check the version of Python installed on your system by running `python --version` or `python3 --version`. Make sure you have a compatible version of Python installed (preferably Python 3.6 or higher).

2. Update `pip`: If you have an older version of `pip`, it's recommended to update it by running `python -m pip install --upgrade pip`.

3. Check package installations: Ensure that the necessary packages are installed correctly. You can try reinstalling `pip` and `setuptools` by running the following commands:

   ```
   python -m pip install --force-reinstall pip
   python -m pip install --force-reinstall setuptools
   ```

4. Virtual environment: If you are working within a virtual environment, deactivate it and reactivate it again to ensure a clean environment.

If the issue persists after following these steps, it might be helpful to provide more information about your Python version and the specific steps you took before encountering this error.

    __import__(modulename, globals(), locals(), level=0)
  File "/usr/share/python-wheels/pkg_resources-0.0.0-py2.py3-none-any.whl/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 77, in <module>
  File "/usr/share/python-wheels/pkg_resources-0.0.0-py2.py3-none-any.whl/pkg_resources/_vendor/packaging/requirements.py", line 9, in <module>
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 1178, in _find_and_load
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 1149, in _find_and_load_unlocked
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 674, in _load_unlocked
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 634, in _load_backward_compatible
  File "/usr/share/python-wheels/pkg_resources-0.0.0-py2.py3-none-any.whl/pkg_resources/extern/__init__.py", line 43, in load_module
  File "/usr/share/python-wheels/pkg_resources-0.0.0-py2.py3-none-any.whl/pkg_resources/_vendor/pyparsing.py", line 943, in <module>
AttributeError: module 'collections' has no attribute 'MutableMapping'

The error message suggests that there is an issue with the `pip` package and its dependencies. The error is related to the `collections` module, which does not have the expected attribute `MutableMapping`.

To resolve this issue, you can try the following steps:

1. Upgrade `pip` manually: Download the `get-pip.py` script from the official Python website using `curl` or `wget`. Here's an example using `curl`:

   ```
   curl https://bootstrap.pypa.io/get-pip.py -o get-pip.py
   ```

   Then, run the script to upgrade `pip`:

   ```
   python get-pip.py --force-reinstall
   ```

   This will ensure you have the latest version of `pip` installed.

2. Clean installation of `pip` and `setuptools`: If upgrading `pip` doesn't resolve the issue, you can try uninstalling `pip` and `setuptools` completely and then reinstalling them:

   ```
   python -m pip uninstall pip setuptools
   python -m ensurepip --upgrade
   ```

   After this, try installing `pip` again:

   ```
   python -m ensurepip --default-pip
   ```

3. Python environment: If you are working within a virtual environment, consider creating a new environment and installing the required packages there. This can help isolate any conflicts or issues with the current environment.

If none of the above steps work, it might be helpful to provide more information about your Python version and any other relevant details that could help in troubleshooting the issue further.
